name: Daphne indica
Relationship: Antidotes: BRY.; RHUS. Compare: FLUOR-AC.; AUR; MEZ.; STAPH.

Head: Tongue coated on one side only
Heat in head, especially in vertex
Feels as if skull would burst; as if head were separated from body
Foul-smelling, ptyalism hot
Urine: Thick, turbid, yellowish, like rotten eggs
Sleep: Starting on falling to sleep with chilliness and clamminess
Entire inability to sleep; sometimes caused by aching in bones
Extremities: Pain shoots upward into abdomen and heart
Shooting pains, shift rapidly; worse, cold air
Rheumatic pains in thighs and knees

details: Acts on lower tissues, muscles, bones and skin. Sudden, lightning jerks in different parts of the body. CRAVING FOR TOBACCO. Burning in stomach. Parts of the body feel separated. (BAPT.) FETID breath, urine, sweat.
